summary: Internal DOJ email chain from June 27, 2019, discussing the retrieval of a non-public appendix to the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). The appendix reportedly contains a list of victims entitled to compensation. The correspondence involves the Office of Professional Responsibility and the Public Corruption Unit.

persons.name: Director and Chief Counsel Office of Professional Responsibility
persons.context: Responds to an inquiry about the Epstein NPA appendix, stating OPR can help and copying someone separately.

persons.name: Chief Public Corruption Unit
persons.role: Chief of the Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: Initiates the email inquiry asking if the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) has a copy of the non-public Epstein NPA appendix containing a victim compensation list.

connections.person2: Director and Chief Counsel Office of Professional Responsibility
connections.description: The Chief of the Public Corruption Unit emails the Director/Chief Counsel of OPR to request assistance in retrieving a document.

events.title: DOJ Inquiry into Epstein NPA Appendix
events.description: Internal DOJ emails are exchanged regarding the retrieval of a non-public appendix to the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement that contains a list of victims entitled to compensation.
personsInvolved: Director and Chief Counsel Office of Professional Responsibility

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Washington, D.C. 20530
United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: A non-public appendix to the Epstein Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) exists.
This appendix includes a list of victims entitled to receive compensation.
As of June 2019, the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) was being asked if it possessed a copy of this appendix.
The Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) was indicated as being able to help retrieve the document.
